intro: Lepidobolus eurardyensis, commonly known as the Mount Lofty lepidobolus, is a flowering plant native to South Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, aromatic leaves and clusters of white or pink flowers. It typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Lepidobolus eurardyensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological niche and limited distribution.
